title: Green gooseberry jelly cheesecake with red gooseberry compôte
description: The tartness of a gooseberry is a strange concept for a Frenchman but the challenge of trying to conquer its sourness and create flavoursome dishes from it was attractive. This cheesecake is a triumph and I’m now happy to adopt these northern green berries in my cooking. Equipment and preparation: for this recipe you will need a sugar thermometer, an electric whisk, a blender and a 4cm/1½in deep, 20cm/8in pastry ring or cake tin.
ingredients: 1 tbsp vanilla purée or good-quality vanilla extract
¼ lemon, juice only, plus an extra drop for the egg whites
200g/7oz green gooseberries (such as Invicta), washed, stalks removed and cut in half
2¼ gelatine leaves, softened in water then drained
about 10–12 firm green gooseberries, stalks removed
